title: Age-old question -- Fixing FF after an update (version 94)
content:
Hi all...

Latest FF on windows 10.

After an update to FF v94 it broke the nice layout I enjoyed for a while.

Now I can't find any *.css code to fix the issues. I'm familiar with the process so it's not that I don't know how to access the Profile folder, or create the CHROME folder, etc.

The: "toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets" is set to true.

Here are the issues: 1) The ordering of the menus at the top of the page are unorganized. The ordering I had, and would like to get back are: 

  a) URL   b) Tabs   c) Bookmarks

Right now the ordering is: a, c, b

Also, the 'close tab' ( "X" ) is too large. The "X" on the current tab is too large (pic). When there are multiple tabs open it occupies a third of the tab width.

And lastly, I'd like it as I had it before where during a hover of any tab the "X" would show if I wanted to close a particular tab besides the current tab.

I've found and used and was thankful for the css files I found in the past. They seemed to fix the issue without TOO much hassle. I've been messing with this firefox-nonsense for several days.

I don't understand the css code to modify things. What I do make changes to doesn't seem to do anything, or it gives unexpected results that don't seem to make sense (to me).

I'll share the code I'm using. I found it form a post in here somewhere.

Thanks to anyone that can help. I'd sure appreciate it. I'm annoyed at FF for continually breaking my layout and not bothering to provide a way to put it back as we like it.

/* Source file https://github.com/MrOtherGuy/firefox-csshacks/tree/master/chrome/tabs_on_bottom.css made available under Mozilla Public License v. 2.0 See the above repository for updates as well as full license text. */

/* Modify to change window drag space width */ /* Use tabs_on_bottom_menubar_on_top_patch.css if you have menubar permanently enabled and want it on top

  • /

/* IMPORTANT */ /* Get window_control_placeholder_support.css Window controls will be all wrong without it. Additionally on Linux, you may need to get: linux_gtk_window_control_patch.css

  • /
root{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 0px; }

@media (-moz-os-version: windows-win10){

root[sizemode="maximized"][tabsintitlebar]{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 8px }

}

  1. toolbar-menubar[autohide="true"] > .titlebar-buttonbox-container,
  2. TabsToolbar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{

position: fixed; display: block; top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px); right:0; height: 40px; } /* Mac specific. You should set that font-smoothing pref to true if you are on any platform where window controls are on left */ @supports -moz-bool-pref("layout.css.osx-font-smoothing.enabled"){

root{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 0pxÂ !important }

.titlebar-buttonbox-container{ left:0; right: unsetÂ !important; } }

root[uidensity="compact"] #TabsToolbar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ height: 32px }
  1. toolbar-menubar[inactive] > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ opacity: 0 }
  1. navigator-toolbox{ padding-top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px)Â !important; }

.titlebar-buttonbox-container > .titlebar-buttonbox{ height: 100%; }

  1. titlebar{

-moz-box-ordinal-group: 2; -moz-appearance: noneÂ !important; --tabs-navbar-shadow-size: 0px; }

.titlebar-placeholder,

  1. TabsToolbar .titlebar-spacer{ display: none; }

/* Also hide the toolbox bottom border which isn't at bottom with this setup */

  1. navigator-toolbox::after{ display: noneÂ !important; }

@media (-moz-gtk-csd-close-button){ .titlebar-button{ -moz-box-orient: vertical } }

/* These exist only for compatibility with autohide-tabstoolbar.css */ toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar.browser-toolbar{ animation: none; }

  1. navigator-toolbox:hover #TabsToolbar{ animation: slidein ease-out 48ms 1 }

/* Source file https://github.com/MrOtherGuy/firefox-csshacks/tree/master/chrome/tabs_on_bottom_menubar_on_top_patch.css made available under Mozilla Public License v. 2.0 See the above repository for updates as well as full license text. */

/* Menubar on top patch - use with tabs_on_bottom.css */ /* Only really useful if menubar is ALWAYS visible */

root{ --uc-window-control-width: 0pxÂ !important }
  1. navigator-toolbox{ padding-top: calc(29px + var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px))Â !important }
  1. toolbar-menubar{

position: fixed; display: flex; top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px); height: 29px; width: 100%; overflow: hidden; }

  1. toolbar-menubar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ height: 29px; order: 100; }
  1. toolbar-menubar > [flex]{ flex-grow: 100; }
  2. toolbar-menubar > spacer[flex]{

order: 99; flex-grow: 1; min-width: var(--uc-window-drag-space-width,20px); }

  1. toolbar-menubar .titlebar-button{ padding: 2px 17pxÂ !important; }
  1. toolbar-menubar .toolbarbutton-1 { --toolbarbutton-inner-padding: 3px }

/* TABS: height */*|*:root { --tab-toolbar-navbar-overlap: 0pxÂ !important; --tab-min-height: 25pxÂ !important; /*adjust to set height or omit to use density*/ --tab-min-width: 80pxÂ !important; /*adjust to set width or omit to use default*/

  1. tabbrowser-tabs {

width: 100vwÂ !important; }

  1. main-window:not([chromehidden*="toolbar"]) #navigator-toolbox {padding-bottom: var(--tab-min-height)Â !important;}

.tab-background { border-radius: 8px 8px 0px 0pxÂ !important; border-image: noneÂ !important; } .tab-line { display: none; }

.tab-close-button { color: red!important; }

title: Is there a way to force ALL links (in Gmail) to open in a new tab?
content:
From searching the forum, I understand that links that do not specify a target window always open in the same tab.

Other than holding the Control key down when left-clicking the link, or right-clicking and having to choose "open in a new tab", is there a way to FORCE all links (in Gmail) to always open in a new tab (in either options or preferences)?

In my about:preferences I have browser. link. open_newwindow parameter set to 3 (which I understand does not help for links that don't specify a target window).

In my settings for Tabs, I have check boxes enabled for Open Links in Tabs Instead of New Windows and also for Switch to New Tab Immediately. Neither works for links that do not specify a target window.

It seems to me (and I may be wrong) that Firefox ALWAYS previously opened ALL my Gmail links in a new tab, regardless of whether they specified a target (or not). So, I'm suspecting I may have inadvertently changed a setting to cause this behavior?

Any thoughts will be greatly appreciated as this current behavior (i. e., clicking a link in an email message overwriting Gmail in the current tab and bringing up the clicked link) is a real nuisance. Thanks.

title: Possible Regression in Firefox 94: SmartCard not usable
content:
Hi all,

I use a SmartCard containing a PKI Certificate to log into a Website. I'm on a Mac (OS 11 Big Sur) and am using the OpenSC PKCS#11 module which I added to Firefox manually.

Up until recently, this worked in Firefox: When I visited the login page, I was prompted to select a certificate to use for the login. I chose the one from my SmartCard, and the login worked.

However, after Upgrading to Firefox 94, this stopped working. Now there is no longer a prompt when I visit the login page, so I cannot select a certificate. The login then always fails.

I checked the "cryptography devices" settings (the OpenSC PKCS#11 module is loaded and working, I can activate the SmartCard) and "certificates" settings (deleted saved authentication decisions & cached certificates etc). On the macOS level, I cannot see the SmartCard in the keychain app (I never could, even when it was still working), but using the Terminal command "pcsctest" I can confirm that the SmartCard is recognized and working. I tried completely reinstalling OpenSC and Firefox, but to now avail. No other components were changed when it stopped working (no updates of macOS/OpenSC, all certificates are still valid, network hasn't changed). The only thing that works, is going back to Firefox 93 where the login works as usual.

So I'm pretty sure that this is a Bug introduced in the upgrade from 93 to 94.

Has anyone else experienced something similar, or does anyone have any suggestions regarding this issue? That would be much appreciated.

Best Regards
creator: jeremias.lubberger

title: Image does not appear after login
content:
Hi all,

I use Firefox 94.0.1 (64 bits) on my Windows 10 computer and for a few days now, Firefox has had issues downloading images on all websites. I found out that images download again when I disconnect from my Firefox account and refresh Firefox (via the about:support page). But as soon as I reconnect to my account, the issue comes back again.

I found the following support page (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/fix-problems-images-not-show) and followed most of the tips: - Clearing cache and history --> Doesn't help - Create a new Firefox profile --> Doesn't help - Check image permissions for a specific website --> It's a general problem, not specific to a website - Security software --> I don't have any antivirus beside Windows defender - Extensions --> I deactivated all extensions - browser.display.document_color_use is set to 0 - Refresh Firefox --> Doesn't help after reconnecting to my account

Any idea on how to solve this issue?

Thank you very much!

Michel

title: youtube doest buffer videos in firefox but other browsers can
content:

But my network admin uses google chrome and it was working on google chrome. And I Don't want to switch to any other browser

What I have triedÂ :-

  • reinstalled Firefox multiple times on different devices
  • refreshed Firefox multiple times , opened Firefox in safe mode
  • tweaked some advanced preferences (it didn't worked)
  • tried other browsers (other browsers don't have a issue on the same network)

Note:- YouTube doesn't have any issue in Firefox 87.0.0 it only occurs on Firefox 88+

I have also attached two photos one of Firefox 87 (showing it is buffering properly ) and one of Firefox 94.0.1 ( showing it is not buffering properly )

Both the Version of Firefox were on same network and tested on same date

title: PDF access
content: I cannot find any way to report problems, this seems to be the only way. When I try to open any PDF file, I have to Browse to find my pdf viewer (Flexipdf 2022). I do that and also check your "Do this automatically" option. Every time I try to open a pdf after that I still have to go through all the same Browse steps. I also set up Flexipdf 2022 in the Applications section of General Settings (Portable Document Format (PDF) (application/pdf)) and it is just deleted or never saved. The next time I look or try to use it, itâs gone. This is obviously a bug in your system, please correct. Thank You.
creator: ddavissci

title: Firefox 93 onwards does not open new tabs in first window
content:
I am using Firefox 94 on Debian Linux (details below). I've been a happy FF user for many years but, ever since I updated to Firefox 93, I've been facing an odd problem.

When I start FF (usually using my system launcher or the command line), the first window that opens will not allow me to open a new tab. Press the '+' button does nothing; trying to open links in a new tab does nothing; etc. Not only this, but it seems like there are other problems (e.g. my adblocker does not seem to be working in YouTube), but I can't confirm this.

When I open a new window from the menu, all functions work normally in the new window. But the original window continues to have these problems.

This isn't a major inconvenience, but it just seems like an odd bug.

One factor that might have something to do with this - I run FF inside Firejail. I start FF via a one line script:

`firejail /opt/firefox/firefox`

Maybe this has something to do with it?

Thanks so much to Mozilla for this wonderful piece of software, and to all of you for helping out with it!
creator: shankargopal2008

title: actualice el navegador y el audio se escucha mal, entrecortado y chicharrea
content: actualice el navegador y ahora el audio se escucha, mal entrecortado y con chicharreo.

title: Gmail
content: In Email, with every other click on a mail item, I get the message "Firefox is not responding." After 15-20 seconds the mail continues, but the same thing happens again, and again. Checking the mail is nerve wrecking.
creator: frankfurtergeorge2

title: How do I restore the original Firefox theme
content:
How do we go back to the original Firefox theme? It had a much better balance of colors and was more pleasing to the eye! The present default grey/white theme is terrible -- no contrast between tabs etc. There are thousands of Firefox themes to choose from, many are very fancy and some very dark (including the photon theme). Who has the time to go through and try them all or to build a new theme. The Firefox group had the perfect theme already built!

Is it so difficult to place the original simple Firefox theme as a selection in the theme library labelled "Original" and make the theme library searchable by name? At the very least it should have been left as an option in the themes category!

In future, updates should give the option of keeping the present default theme.

Very frustrating not to be given the option of the original theme!! David
creator: dhaase

title: Instagram links broken
content:
Ever since the last two updates, whenever I am on Instagram (i have Win 10 PC version) and I click on a photo to see a larger version, I get this message: 

                                         Sorry, this page isn't available.

The link you followed may be broken, or the page may have been removed. Go back to Instagram.

It does not occur on the Instagram stories.

It only happens on Firefox not on Chrome. Chrome works fine.
creator: fangore11

title: printing from browser
content: When I try to print from within Firefox 94.01 the document is printed in the upper left quadrant of letter size paper. The preview and all information on the printer seem fine. If I try to print the same document from Chrome, it works fine. When I tried about:config and typed in paper_data I get a new box open with three options: boolean, number or string. I never get anything beyond that. No list of paper sizes. Nothing. Any help would be most appreciated. Thank you!
creator: sbarnes1915
